body: Better to remain a news feed and `learn more` button on the top, instead of removing info.
Thanks. I updated to announce repository migration.

Could you please close this PR? PR from your fork is expected. I cannot delete this branch while I removed it from ASF git :-( Found a typo in `Ou*t* project repository was migrated` => `Our project repository migrated` BTW, it's a meaningless new feed. `We are planning the initial Apache release on Q1, 2017. ` would be a better message.
Sure will do. Thanks.
merged in https://github.com/apache/incubator-hivemall/commit/a2f78df058b3ee6ad55b6d980366a4495f468fa2

Thank you for the contribution. Could you close this issue?

hmm... It seems the contributor is not tracked on github.

When using github squash web UI, it was tracked https://github.com/apache/incubator-hivemall/commit/effe461446f2af84931901c112d542b8d2e69cfd though

@Lewuathe Could you update the project site as well? Do you know the instructions?
You can use `bin/build_site.sh` to build the site.

git://git.apache.org/incubator-hivemall-site.git (asf branch)
Careful Direct update of web contents is permitted for committers.

Thanks. I updated the site.
http://hivemall.incubator.apache.org/

Thanks.
I'm considering to review and merge this PR after finishing #13 .

Usage

```sql
use a9a;

create external table train (
  rowid int,
  label float,
  features ARRAY<STRING>
) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
  FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
  COLLECTION ITEMS TERMINATED BY "," 
STORED AS TEXTFILE LOCATION 's3://myui-dev/Datasets/a9a/train/';

create external table test (
  rowid int, 
  label float,
  features ARRAY<STRING>
) ROW FORMAT DELIMITED 
  FIELDS TERMINATED BY '\t' 
  COLLECTION ITEMS TERMINATED BY "," 
STORED AS TEXTFILE LOCATION 's3://myui-dev/Datasets/a9a/test/';

create or replace view test_exploded as
select 
  t1.rowid,
  t2.h,
  t2.hk,
  t2.Xh,
  t2.Xk
from
  test t1
  LATERAL VIEW feature_pairs(features, "-kpa") t2 as h, hk, Xh, Xk;
  
drop table kpa_model;
create table kpa_model as
select 
 h,
 hk, 
 avg(w0) as w0,
 avg(w1) as w1,
 avg(w2) as w2,
 avg(w3) as w3
from 
 (select 
     train_kpa(features,label,"-c 0.01") as (h, w0, w1, w2, hk, w3)
  from 
     train
 ) t 
group by h, hk;

create or replace view kpa_predict 
as
WITH p1 as (
select
  t1.rowid, 
  kpa_predict(
    t1.Xh, -- nullable 0
    t1.Xk, -- nullable 1
    m1.w0, -- nullable 2
    m1.w1, -- nullable 3
    m1.w2, -- nullable 4
    m2.w3  -- nullable 5
  ) as score
from 
  test_exploded t1
  LEFT OUTER JOIN kpa_model m1 ON (m1.h = t1.h)
  LEFT OUTER JOIN kpa_model m2 ON (m2.hk = t1.hk)
group by
  rowid
)
select
  rowid,
  case when score > 0.0 then 1 else 0 end as label
from
  p1;

create or replace view kpa_submit as
select 
  t.label as actual, 
  p.label as predicted
from 
  test t 
  JOIN kpa_predict p on (t.rowid = p.rowid);

select count(1)/16281 from kpa_submit 
where actual = predicted;

> 0.8241508506848474
```

@maropu Could you take a look at?
@wangyum Thank you for the contribution. Merged with small modifications.
TravisCI always pass these tests though, why did you got the error? What's your environment?
Oh, I got you. So, how about setting these values along with the spark one (e.g., -mx3g)? See: https://github.com/apache/spark/blob/master/pom.xml#L2066
okay, LGTM cc: @myui
@maropu BTW, why `mvn -q scalastyle:check test -Pspark-2.0" exited with 1` is happening?

@myui In running the test, a spark context and unit tests work in the same JVM. The context uses at most 1g memory by default. So, in some conditions, the unit tests run short of memory, I think. If we set 3g at the value, the context uses 1g and the tests do 2g. That sounds fine to me.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/9792621/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/9792621)

Coverage remained the same at 35.842% when pulling **37da2269a478d40b53aa7cef237ab3367cad0a2e on wangyum:HIVEMALL-30** into **ed16ca002e3d61f1a3b30e35487fa45e603d4f59 on apache:master**.

@maropu It seems full GC is still happening for some cases...
```
HivemallFeatureOpsSuite:
No output has been received in the last 10m0s, this potentially indicates a stalled build or something wrong with the build itself.
```

`MaxPermGen=1024m` might be too big and it might need more space for other stuffs. Do we need `-MaxPermGen` ? Less parameter is better for configuring JVM. We can use just 4GB in TravisCi while there are 3 tasks (openjdk7, oraclejdk8, oraclejdk8) in each job.
@myui How about 512m? Sorry, but I forgot why I set that value there though, I checked the spark configure and I found that value is 512m.
I'll try to set 512m.

Coverage decreased (-0.005%) to 35.837% when pulling **f623a6aca7766f98ad7a4c29578611dfa486cfcd on maropu:CheckCompiler** into **d95f1e79daa421d738bfe9e6dcc76c7230013406 on apache:master**.

LGTM. @maropu Could you update ASF master as follows:

```
git checkout master
# create working branch from master
git checkout -b hotfix/CheckCompiler
# apply changes of this patch
git pull https://github.com/maropu/incubator-hivemall.git CheckCompiler
# get committer name/address
git log | grep "Author" | head -1
# move back to master
git checkout master
# merge squash of this patch
git merge --squash hotfix/CheckCompiler
# update commit log (required for closing a github issue) 
git commit -a --author="Takeshi Yamamuro <foo@me.com>" --message="Close #24: Print explicit error messages in building xgboost with clang"
# push changes to ASF master
git push origin master
```

Note that it assumes that `origin` is https://git-wip-us.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator-hivemall.git
okay, I'll do
Merged.

Remove the [QueryTest.checkJsonFormat](https://github.com/apache/incubator-hivemall/blob/v0.5-alpha.1/spark/spark-2.0/src/test/scala/org/apache/spark/sql/QueryTest.scala#L231), see [SPARK-17426](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SPARK-17426)
